result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan M Vollriede was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED OF $150.00. Restitution in the amount of $1,128.29 to his Grandfather (W.S.) to be paid as a Condition of Probation along with Restitution surcharges.

AS OF 10/14/2016: Change initials above for Grandfather to D.A.

Court Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with his Grandfather (W.S.) unless he consents.

It is the Defendant's burden to petition the Court to receive the benefit of expunction. Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions with release for work and/or treatment.  Sentence credit for 87 days was granted.
Concurrent with: Case 15CM1802.
Outstanding fees and costs to be converted to a civil judgment.

HUBER:  6 months with release for work and/or treatment (CREDIT - 87 days).  Concurrent to 15CM1802.



COUNT 2:

HUBER:  6 months with release for work and/or treatment (CREDIT - 87 days.  Concurrent.
